title: Error Message-can not send email  due to STARTTLS?
content:
9/10/2025 After trying to send an email I got the following message. Repeatedly. Called Sitestar's tech support and they tried to fix the issue. Here is the first error message.

Sending of the message failed.

An error occurred while sending mail: Unable to establish a secure link with Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.sitestar.net using STARTTLS since it doesn't advertise that feature. Switch off STARTTLS for that server or contact your service provider.

Sitestar Tech support had me go to account settings, to outgoing server to edit and change the STARTTLS to SSL/TS port and retry sending the test email. Then got this error message:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: H:RB [172.56.209.199] Connection refused due to abuse. Please contact your E-mail provider.. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.

Went back to set up and original error message still shows up and email can not be sent. Any ideas how to fix this. I can still send email thru the sitestar website, but not from my laptop. I think I used up all the Site star tech supports brain cells. I use the latest thunderbird. We connect to the internet via a T-mobile tower thing. Windows 11 Thank you
creator: Sunflowr

title: Automatic deletion of emails from server
content:
I use the Plusnet webmail server and find that every so often have to manually empty the Plusnet inbox. I do not want to automatically deleting them from my computer. I have set up my Thunderbird account using pop3 and have tried all the combinations of settings in the heading...server settings..and checking and unchecking...... Leave messages on server For at most Until I delete them

and can not get the account to delete any emails from the server. Do I need to set something else under disk space? When you set For at most 14 days, is that 14 days from the email arriving at the computer, or 14 days from setting it to 14 days? Is there something that a am failing to do ? Any help gratefully received.

title: Gatekeeper problem: deploy policies.json on MacOS 15.61
content:
I would like to centrally distribute and manage Thunderbird 140 (ESR). We have decided to configure it via policies.json, as we want to manage Windows endpoints as well as Macs.

In a later stage, the installation script will be distributed via Intune.

I am currently testing the script on my Mac with macOS 15.6.1. The script performs the following steps:

I am able to create policies.json and the distribution folder, but Thunderbird can no longer be started because the app is corrupted.

After some research, it appears that Gatekeeper from MacOS is probably responsible for this. When the policies.json file is saved, the code signature is no longer valid after startup. As a result, Gatekeeper no longer allows Thunderbird to run.

Does anyone have any ideas on what I could do to prevent this problem from occurring?

Translated with DeepL.com (free version)
creator: christian.wistl

title: Unable to access my 12 year old Thunderbird account.
content:
Hello, Some 12-14 years ago my US based website manager signed me up with Thunderbird since he was having issues getting my Outlook to be compatible with his server. It had been relatively trouble free until recently.

When a recent update occured it appeared that Thunderbird had vaporized my e-mails from 2023/24. I had/have numerous e-mails related to a lawsuit that is tremendously important to me. I read on Mozilla's site about a program alled Recoverit from Wondershare. It did not appear to work at all. Not too long after my Lenovo PC died. The techa at Memory Express could only see a single program on my hard drive when I took the hard drive to them for analysis. I subsequently sent the drive to Secure Data 

and they are sending it back to me.

In the meantime my replacement computer is an HP laptop. I purchased Windows 365 since they provided a technician to assist with setup. The tech could not get Thunderbird to work nor could they make Outlook work, MS blamed the server. The server guy says ir works, I have been without my e-mail for more than 6 weeks.

Can anyone help?
creator: Daryllaz1

title: Correttore ortografico: malfunzionamento
content:
Buongiorno. Segnalo un problema con il correttore ortografico, che si presenta anche in modalità risoluzione problemi. Il correttore ortografico che da mie impostazioni appare e viene eseguito all'invio di ognimessaggio, funziona male. Segnala errore ma nessun termine viene indicato: la casella in bianco. Posso indicare ignora 10 volte di fila, ma tutto resta come è. Per superare l'empasse, devo chiudere il correttore e allora la email viene indicata. In sintesi: nella finestra del correttore non vengono mostrati gli errori, nè appare il tasto invia, ne si può proseguire se non interrompendo. Idee? Mozilla Thunderbird 140.2.1esr (32 bit) su Win11.

Grazie
creator: reccino

title: Visualizzazione ricevuta di ritorno
content: Ho la versione 142.0 (64 bit) ed ho notato che all'arrivo di un messaggio non visualizzo più automaticamente la richiesta di ricevuta di ritorno avanzata dal mittente (con la versione precedente invece appariva). Devo necessariamente cliccare sull'icona rettangolare "Apri in una nuova scheda" per poterla visualizzare ed eventualmente concedere la ricevuta. La struttura della visualizzazione è verticale.

title: I can no longer send or receive emails using Thunderbird
content:
I can no longer send or receive emails using Thunderbird (my email client, hereafter referred to as TB). I've tried checking my internet connection, restarting TB, restarting my PC, and even launching it directly from the command prompt with administrator privileges, but nothing worked. None of these methods produce any error messages, and the sending/receiving gauge just fills up and then stops after a while.

One thing I can think of is that there was some kind of Windows update yesterday. Unlike the Windows 24h updates that cause the internet to become unavailable, this was completed quickly. I'm not sure if that was the cause, but I noticed a problem with TB afterwards.

Given this, I thought I'd try to recover my PC, but I can't find a recovery button in the system update? menu, so I'm at a dead end. Please tell me what to do. By the way, TB is POP3.
creator: dilon1942

title: Connection to IMAP server timing out
content:
Good day,

I'm experiencing this problem with Thunderbird for a couple of weeks, while before everything worked normally: when sending emails, the connection to imap.servermx.com times out, and as a result a copy of the message is not placed in the account folder (then I'm asked whether I want to place a copy in a local folder, and this sometimes works - though it is not what I want - and sometimes not). Also, I don't receive notifications of sent emails in my inbox.

So, just to sum up: - "Copying message to sent folder" lasts very long, and it doesn't work. Then - "Connecting to imap.servermx.com" lasts very long, and it doesn't work. - I then receive the message in the image, asking whether I want to save the message in a local folder (working randomly).

I've been travelling for a couple of days and things worked fine with the network of the hotel I've been staying at. Problems started again once I came back home.

I approached my network operator, who detected an old version of my router's firmware, and proceeded with an update. As a result, the problem disappeared, but came back today in the middle of the morning. I approached again the network operator and things look fine from their perspective.

I'd appreciate any support you could provide me with, so that I can get back to the network operator with some advice on how to possibly fix this issue.

Thank you in advance, kind regards,

Marco
creator: marco.fico

title: Information requests for Thundermail Pro service
content:
Hello, I've been really curious about Thundermail. We have a number of problems running our own home email server, DNS records - SPF - DKIM - DMARC settings. Then followed by internet drop outs, which always seem to wait for the family to leave the house.

So I was wondering if Thundermail help remove some of these headaches. 1) WIll thundermail provide a forwarding solution, such that emails will be first go onto the Thundermail Server, prior to heading to our local home email server (synology). If the network connection to our home server fails then thunderbird holds the emails? 2) Will Thundermail does all of the security - spam / virus checking? 3) Will I need as a user and custom domain manager, need to update DNS records at our domain name server?

Many thanks Dave
creator: dave320

creator: johnjmouse

title: Storage Space Issues and IMAP Synchronization Settings in Thunderbird
content:
Good morning, We are a company with around 10 employees and we use Thunderbird as our email client across multiple workstations. Some of our IMAP-configured mailboxes are used on several PCs and have grown quite large, causing local storage space issues.

I recently discovered that Thunderbird offers settings to manage synchronization more efficiently — for example, by limiting the download of messages to the last X days (e.g., 30 days), or by excluding certain folders from automatic synchronization. I’m referring specifically to the options under: Account Settings > Synchronization & Storage > Advanced…, and also the Disk Space section.

I tried changing these settings on an already configured account, but the changes don’t seem to take effect — messages are still being fully synchronized. I would like to know: 

   If I’m doing something wrong in the process; 
   If these changes only apply when configuring a new account; 
   What is the recommended way to manage large IMAP mailboxes in a business environment to reduce local storage impact and improve performance.

Unfortunately, our email provider doesn’t offer alternative solutions unless we completely change the IMAP configuration, which we would prefer to avoid.

Thank you in advance for your support — I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
creator: digitale1
